ingredients.content: 500 g lamb shoulder meat, cut into pieces (4 cm)
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper, adjust to taste

preparations.content: Place coriander and parsley into mixing bowl and chop <b>7 sec/speed 8<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place onions into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>.

Add pieces of lamb meat, 2 tsp salt, pepper and 40 g olive oil and cook <b>10 min/120°C//speed <b>. Meanwhile, cut carrots, turnips and courgettes into chunks (approx. 4 cm) and set aside. Place couscous, 1 tsp salt and 20 g olive oil in a bowl. Rub couscous in a circular motion between your hands to moisten grains evenly and remove any lumps that may form, cover with 350 g water and stir using spatula to moisten couscous evenly. Cover bowl and set aside.

Add reserved vegetables, chopped coriander and parsley, cinnamon, ginger and 500 g water to mixing bowl. Gently fluff the couscous with a fork to separate grains and transfer to Varoma tray. Place Varoma dish and tray into position and cook <b>15 min/Varoma//speed <b>. Remove Varoma and set aside.
Add raisins, chick peas and saffron, cook again <b>15 min/100°C//speed <b>. Transfer lamb and vegetables to deep plates. Cover with sauce and serve with couscous.
